  "Broker Comment" : "This complaint was filed by my client's son, who is a registered financial advisor.  The allegations are baseless, false and completely without merit.  There has been no adverse impact to the client's estate or capital gains over the life of my relationship with the father, my client.  Before his other son took over POA on the account, my client (father) never expressed any dissatisfaction with my service of his account."

{
  "Allegations" : "Time Frame: January 3, 2017 to April 4, 2017 The client is demanding $420,375 in which he alleges, represents the additional tax liability caused by the FA's failure to transfer certain shares of stock to the Minneapolis foundation within the regulatory window and closing window.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$420,375.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "The client did not provide any written or verbal instructions to transfer any shares, to any entity, prior to the closing of the transaction between GK and Cintas. There was no communication to me, as the financial advisor, to move any shares to any charitable entity, either in writing or verbally, prior to the closing. The client made no representations that he was or was not going to make a charitable contribution prior to the closing date of the GK sale to Cintas. The client was made aware of the options to make a charitable contribution and confirmed by his CPA. He was also informed of the initial transaction announcement, in August of 2016, and notified of the shareholder approval in November of 2016. The client's CPA provided instructions to sell certain shares in 2016 for the client and no further instructions were provided to UBS or myself."
}
